    • Method Detail

      • file

        public static java.io.FileReader file​(java.lang.String filename)
        Return a FileReader based on the filename given.
        Parameters:
        filename - file to read
        Returns:
        the FileReader of the file, null if the file doesn't exist

      • symbol

        public Symbol symbol​(LexicalUnit lexicalUnit)
        Create a new symbol based on the current state (text, line, column). The symbols is added to symbols list. If the lexical unit is LexicalUnit.VARNAME, and the VarName is encountered for the first time, the value and the line of the symbol are added to identifiers
        Parameters:
        lexicalUnit - lexical unit associated to the symbol to create
        Returns:
        the created symbol object

      • idAlreadyScan

        public boolean idAlreadyScan​(java.lang.String identifier)
        Check if an identifier had already been encountered during the scan.
        Parameters:
        identifier - key (identifier) to test
        Returns:
        true if identifier is in identifiers, false otherwise.

      • addIdentifier

        public void addIdentifier​(java.lang.String identifier,
                          int idLine)
        Add key: identifier, value: idLine to identifiers. idLine is incremented before adding the identifiers.
        Parameters:
        identifier - identifier to add
        idLine - line where the identifier was encountered.

      • postScan

        public void postScan​()
        Process post-analyze procedure: Outputs: - Prints all scanned symbols (token) (using toString(LexicalUnit) to stdout). - a new line - 'Identifiers' line to separate from the tokens - and a line per identifier with the corresponding first-encountering line.

      • identifiersKeysSorted

        public java.lang.String[] identifiersKeysSorted​()
        Sort the identifiers alphabetically, and return an array of String identifiers.
        Returns:
        an array of String of encountered identifiers, sorted alphabetically.

        public Symbol scan​()
        Run the lexer and return the next token
        Returns:
        the next token

        Returns:

        public abstract java.lang.String text​()
        Return the current match ERE value.
        Returns:

        public abstract int line​()
        Return the current scanned line, starting at 0.

      • atEOF

        public abstract boolean atEOF​()
        Return true if the scanner is at EOF
        Returns:
        true if at EOF, false otherwise

      • lex

        public abstract Symbol lex​()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Resumes scanning until the next regular expression is matched, the end of input is encountered or an I/O-Error occurs. This based should use the yylex method of the generated scanner by JFlex.
        Returns:
        the next token
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error while reading next token.

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
